Knee osteoarthritis is a disease that leads to the degradation of the knee joint, and its early detection is important for managing the disease. However, standard imaging methods often fail to reveal subtle changes in cartilage health. The purpose of the study was to see if advanced MRI analysis could improve early disease identification. Researchers compared the standard measurement methods with complex models that map the quality of cartilage in specific areas of the knee. The study results showed that a region‐specific model was capable of better distinguishing the early‐stage disease signs.
